wouldn't be freeform then, plus it would be extra work on gms for calculati=
ng dmg and recording it and determining when a bot should die. It's never f=
un for a character to die but it does have to happen sooner or later. 

In =
another game, a fantasy setting much akin to D&D three of my characters hav=
e died. Each to further a plotline (tragic heroes that give their lives for=
 a cause is one of my better writing styles..go figure ;) ) and only one of=
 them has been "brought back" and only once to help complete the current pl=
otline...she died during such as well ;) Another was brought back by the co=
llect efforts of two groups, made some wicked role-playing.

Anyway I'm ram=
bling, the thing is having a character die to fill a plot line here in NBW =
would be pointless...it's been done. And a great battle to kill off excess =
characters before a sequel occurs wouldn't do much. It would drag on and on=
 and on as players managed to slip away or retreat easily. Since you can't =
declare damage for your opponent and if he's been taking damage for the maj=
ority of the battle the "moding" will be overlooked, usually. (there's alwa=
ys a reasonable explanation of how a single bot heavily damaged manages to =
make it all the way back to his or her base before its systems shut down)

=
Basically in and of itself saving your characters is not bad when it makes =
for good role-playing. However saving a character just cause he's about to =
die is rather sad. If he/she/it is about to die...let it die. With five oth=
er characters in reserve it won't be missed! ;)

  ----- Original Message -=
---- 
  From: Starcasm6@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sund=
ay, January 20, 2002 12:12 PM
  Subject: Re: All Read: Important


  maybe =
we need to have strict rules on damage and death. 
  Your use of Yahoo! Gro=
ups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service.
